Constructor Detail

SmiLibRunner

public SmiLibRunner(java.lang.String scaffoldsPath,
                    java.lang.String linkersPath,
                    java.lang.String buildingBlocksPath,
                    boolean printToCommandLine,
                    java.lang.String saveFilePath,
                    boolean addHydrogens,
                    boolean checkSmiles)
Creates a new instance of SmiLibRunner using a FullCombinationIterator (without reaction scheme) for enumerating the virtual library.

Parameters:
scaffoldsPath - path/name of the file that contains scaffolds as SMILES
linkersPath - path/name of the file that contains linkers as SMILES
buildingBlocksPath - path/name of the file that contains building blocks as SMILES
printToCommandLine - combinatorial library shall be printed to the command line true/false
saveFilePath - path/name of the file where the combinatorial library will be stored if it shall be saved in a file
addHydrogens - add hydrogens when save as SD file
checkSmiles - check SMILES for conformity with SMiLib rules true/false

SmiLibRunner

public SmiLibRunner(java.lang.String scaffoldsPath,
                    java.lang.String linkersPath,
                    java.lang.String buildingBlocksPath,
                    java.lang.String reactionSchemePath,
                    boolean printToCommandLine,
                    java.lang.String saveFilePath,
                    boolean addHydrogens,
                    boolean checkSmiles)
Creates a new instance of SmiLibRunner using a PartialCombinationIterator (with reaction scheme) for enumerating the virtual library.

Parameters:
scaffoldsPath - path/name of the file that contains scaffolds as SMILES
linkersPath - path/name of the file that contains linkers as SMILES
buildingBlocksPath - path/name of the file that contains building blocks as SMILES
reactionSchemePath - path/filename of the file that contains the reaction scheme
printToCommandLine - combinatorial library shall be printed to the command line true/false
saveFilePath - path/name of the file where the combinatorial library will be stored if it shall be saved in a file
addHydrogens - add hydrogens when save as SD file
checkSmiles - check SMILES for conformity with SMiLib rules true/false

SmiLibRunner

public SmiLibRunner(java.lang.String[] scaffolds,
                    java.lang.String[] linkers,
                    java.lang.String[] bBlocks,
                    boolean useReactionScheme,
                    java.lang.String[] reactionScheme,
                    javax.swing.JTextArea targetTextArea,
                    boolean showLibrary,
                    boolean saveAsFile,
                    boolean saveAsSDF,
                    boolean addHydrogens,
                    java.lang.String path,
                    SmiLibFrame frame,
                    boolean checkSmiles)
Creates a new instance of SmiLibRunner, used when programm is started in GUI mode.

Parameters:
scaffolds - array of source scaffold (with ID)
linkers - array of source linkers (with ID)
bBlocks - array of source building block (with ID)
useReactionScheme - use reaction scheme true/false
reactionScheme - reactionScheme as array
targetTextArea - text area where library will be written in
showLibrary - show library in GUI true/false
saveAsFile - save library as file true/false
saveAsSDF - save file as SD file true/false
addHydrogens - add implicit hydrogens when building the SD file true/false
path - path/name of file where library will be saved
frame - main frame of GUI
checkSmiles - check smiles for SmiLib conformity true/false

SmiLibRunner

public SmiLibRunner(java.lang.String[] scaffolds,
                    java.lang.String[] linkers,
                    java.lang.String[] bBlocks,
                    java.lang.String[] reactionScheme,
                    boolean checkSmiles,
                    SmilesWriter smiWri)
Creates a new instance of SmiLibRunner that can be conveniently used in other Java projects when SmiLib is employed as a Java library.

Example to enumerate a complete SmiLib library: 
 String[] scaffolds = new String[] {"CCC[R1]"};
 String[] linkers = new String[] {"[R][A]"};
 String[] bBlocks = new String[] {"[A]Br", "[A]Cl"};
 SmilesListWriter smiWri = new SmilesListWriter();
 SmiLibRunner runner = new SmiLibRunner(scaffolds, linkers, bBlocks, null, true, smiWri);
 runner.run(); // Run SmiLib
 List<String[]> library = smiWri.getSmilesList(); // Retrieve results
 // String id = library.get(0)[0];
 // String smiles = library.get(0)[1];

Example to enumerate a SmiLib library according to a reaction scheme: 
 String[] scaffolds = new String[] {"CCC[R1]"};
 String[] linkers = new String[] {"[R][A]"};
 String[] bBlocks = new String[] {"[A]Br", "[A]Cl"};
 String[] reactionScheme = new String[] {"1\t1\t2"}; // The reaction scheme
 SmilesListWriter smiWri = new SmilesListWriter();
 SmiLibRunner runner = new SmiLibRunner(scaffolds, linkers, bBlocks, reactionScheme, true, smiWri);
 runner.run(); // Run SmiLib
 List<String[]> library = smiWri.getSmilesList(); // Retrieve results
 // String id = library.get(0)[0];
 // String smiles = library.get(0)[1];

Parameters:
scaffolds - array of source scaffolds, optionally with ID
linkers - array of source linkers, optionally with ID
bBlocks - array of source building blocks, optionally with ID
reactionScheme - reactionScheme as an array. If null, complete enumeration is performed
checkSmiles - check smiles for SmiLib conformity true/false
smiWri - output smiles writer
Since:
2.0 rc4
Method Detail

public void run()
Starts enumeration of the combinatorial library.

Specified by:

handleException

public void handleException(java.lang.Throwable thr)
Centralised Exception handling. Thread ist stopped and a message for each different kind of message is shown/printed.

Parameters:
thr - cause of Error/Exception

setStop

public void setStop(boolean b)
Sets whether this thread shall be stopped or not. Is necessary to cancel enumeration in a save way instead of using "Thread.suspend" (deprecated).

Parameters:
b - cancel enumeration true/false
